intro: Draba pavonii, commonly known as the pavonii whitlow grass, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its simple, often hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine or arctic environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cold climates. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Draba pavonii is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, where it forms dense, low-growing mats.
